title-part.text: CLIMATE CHANGE MITIGATION TECHNOLOGIES IN THE PRODUCTION OR PROCESSING OF GOODS

note.note-paragraph: This subclass covers climate change mitigation technologies in any kind of industrial processing or production activity, including the agroalimentary industry, agriculture, fishing, ranching and the like.

title-part.text: by means other than pyro metallurgy or hydro metallurgy
by increasing the energy efficiency of the process
Design or operational measures for increasing the efficiency of electric conversion
with by-product gas in energy cycle
by process control or by modelling
General improvement of production processes causing greenhouse gases [GHG] emissions
Energy efficiency measures, e.g. energy management
characterised by the type of apparatus
Boilers, furnaces, lighting or vacuum systems
Alternative fuel sources, e.g. for process heat or steam
of biological origin, e.g. biomass, biofuels, biogas
to generate syngas, i.e. H2 + CO
the feedstock being materials of biological origin
Changing the product type or product distribution
by improving the materials, e.g. gauze composition or structure
Improvements relating to adipic acid or caprolactam production
Technologies aiming at reducing N2O emissions
by capture and subsequent thermal oxidation
Improvements relating to the production of products other than chlorine, adipic acid, caprolactam, or chlorodifluoromethane, e.g. bulk or fine chemicals or pharmaceuticals
the solvent being an ionic liquid
Supercritical solvents, e.g. supercritical H2O or CO2
Mixtures of ionic liquids and supercritical solvents
Synthetic design, e.g. reducing the use of auxiliary or protecting groups
of unreacted starting or intermediate materials
involving immobilised starting materials, reagents or catalysts
Technologies relating to oil refining and petrochemical industry
Reduction of greenhouse gas [GHG] emissions during production processes
Carbon capture or storage [CCS] specific to hydrogen production
Furnace or cracking tube materials, e.g. chemical composition of the tubes
Controlling or regulating the tube furnaces
Technologies relating to the processing of minerals
Energy efficiency measures, e.g. improving or optimising the production methods
Reduction of clinker content in cement
Non-limestone based cements, e.g. alkali-activated cements
Manufacturing or processing of sand or stone
Regeneration of lime in pulp and sugar mills
using fuels from renewable energy sources
Reduction of lime consumption, e.g. in sugar industry
Use of cullet or other waste
Reusing waste heat during processing or shaping
CO2 capture, e.g. for large oxy-fuel furnaces
Production of ceramic materials or ceramic elements
Manufacturing of materials for construction, e.g. beams, bricks or tiles
Bricks made from lime and sand
Improving processing, storage or transport systems
Substitution of clay or shale by alternative raw materials, e.g. ashes
Technologies relating to agriculture, livestock or agroalimentary industries
for irrigation, e.g. solar water pumping
Combined machines, e.g. seeder combined with fertilizers
Constructive measures, e.g. light structures or improved insulation
Machines for direct seeding, i.e. sod or grassland seeding
Activities not otherwise provided for, e.g. storage
Reduction of greenhouse gas [GHG] emissions in agriculture
use of additives, e.g. nitrification inhibitors, biochar
Reducing methane [CH4] emissions from agricultural lands, e.g. from rice paddies
Reduction of CO2 emissions from biota and soils
Enhancing carbon sequestration in biota and soils
Use of plant growth regulators to improve carbon dioxide up-take by crop plants
Plants with high carbon sequestration potential
Biomass with low greenhouse gas [GHG] emissions
for pumping or supplying water to livestock
Environmental control in livestock or poultry housing
Use of renewable energies or variable speed drives in handling, conveying or stacking
Ice production, e.g. for conservation purposes
Re-use of by-products of food processing for fodder production
from waste products of dairy plants
Climate change mitigation technologies in the production process for final industrial or consumer products
Greenhouse gas [GHG] capture, material saving, heat recovery or other energy efficient measures, e.g. motor control, characterised by manufacturing processes
related technologies for improving processes or machines for shaping products
Machines for rolling metal, e.g. rolling mills
relating to forging, hammering, pressing or riveting
relating to the manufacture or working of metal sheets or profiles
relating to pressing processes or machines therefore
related technologies for metal working by removing or adding material
Power management, e.g. limiting power to tools
relating to the design or operation of machining centres or machine tools
using minimal quantities of coolants or lubricants
Devices or processes for removing and reusing chips
Machine centres provided for turning, boring or milling
relating to the design or operation of machines for dry cutting gears or toothed racks
Treatment of used abrasive materials aiming at a further reuse
relating to the design or operation of machines for soldering, welding or cutting by applying heat locally
relating to the design or operation of machines for machines for sawing, cutting, perforating, punching or severing
relating to the operation of machines combining different processes for working of metal
relating to the design or operation of machines for working metal not otherwise provided for
related technologies for printing, lining or stamping machines
Technologies for working on wood, veneer or plywood
related technologies for saving energy and raw materials during the production of paper or paper articles

recovering energy or reusing materials in extrusion moulding

related to technologies for conveying, packing or storing of goods or handling thin or filamentary material

Recycling or reuse of a liquid sprayed or atomised

Drying with heating arrangements using waste heat

for tidal streams or dam-less hydropower, e.g. sea flood and ebb or stream current
Manufacturing of lithium-ion, lead-acid or alkaline secondary batteries

Aircraft Eco design, i.e. taking into account the full life cycle of the aircraft including re-use, recyclability and disposal
Greenhouse gas [GHG] capture, heat recovery or other energy efficient measures relating to production or assembly of electric or electronic components or products, e.g. motor control

the product being a lighting component

the product being a dynamo-electric machine, i.e. electrical generators or motors

involving the assembly of several electronic elements

Energy efficient measures, e.g. motor control or heat recovery

of cellulose, cellulose derivatives or proteins

Energy efficient measures, e.g. motor control or heat recovery
Treatment of textiles using a short bath ratio

Energy efficient measures, e.g. motor control or heat recovery

Greenhouse gas [GHG] capture, use of renewable energies, heat recovery or other energy efficient measures for manufacturing or preparation of tobacco products, e.g. motor control

Power supplies with power electronics for efficient use of energy, e.g. power factor correction [PFC] or resonant converters
Control systems or methods for efficient use of energy
using compressed air as energy carrier, e.g. for pneumatic systems
using pressurized fluid as energy carrier, e.g. for hydraulic systems
District level solutions, i.e. local energy networks
On-site combined power, heat or cool generation or distribution, e.g. combined heat and power [CHP] supply
Solar or wind-powered water pumping not specially adapted for irrigation
Minimising material used in manufacturing processes
Enabling technologies with a potential contribution to greenhouse gas [GHG] emissions mitigation
Total factory control, e.g. smart factories, flexible manufacturing systems [FMS] or integrated manufacturing systems [IMS]
characterised by the cooperation between machine tools, manipulators or work piece supply systems
characterised by identification, e.g. of work pieces or equipment
characterised by fault tolerance, reliability of production system
characterised by system universality, i.e. configurability or modularity of production units
characterised by job scheduling, process planning or material flow
characterised by quality surveillance of production
characterised by computer integrated manufacturing [CIM], planning or realisation
characterised by modelling or simulation of the manufacturing system

Electric or hybrid propulsion means for production processes
Combining sequestration of CO2 and exploitation of hydrocarbons by injecting CO2 or carbonated water in oil wells
Energy audits or management systems therefor
Inventory and reporting systems for greenhouse gases [GHG]

CO2 emission certificates or credits trading
